item.title: Schweickart's Bifurcated Hermeneutic
item.description: Elaine Showalter argues for ‘gynocriticism’ - that is, a form of literary criticism that enables women to read and analyze writing written by women. It is ‘genuinely woman-centered, independent, and intellectually coherent’ (Showalter 1981, p.183). Whilst this is undeniably fundamental to recognizing the role of women’s writing to the literary canon, Schweickart (2008) makes a persuasive case for the creation of a literary technique that allows women to read andocentric texts as well.
